section.title: Overview
section.para: The (CRM) module constitutes the bank side of the CRM features available in and found on the client side in the module. It gives a user at a client an electronic channel of communication with the Trade Services team of all the banks his or her company is entitled to liase with through the portal.

This module is primarily for non-transactional requests (for transactions, the appropriate Product module and function should rather be used), and typically provides a way for a user at a client company to submit questions such as requests for quotes on specific services to a bank's trade team.

The organisation of this simple knowledge base is similar to a database of Frequently Asked Questions. You have access to domains representing each relationship your bank has with client companies within . These contain folders, which in turn contain topics with sets of questions and answers.

informalexample.para: For example , imagine your bank (whose abbreviated name is Bank1) has registered two of its customers (Company1 and Company2), granting them access to and its CRM features. You therefore have access to two domains - for communicating with these two companies.

Therefore, when you access the initial screen, you are presented with a list of all the domains your bank has accessed to. In the situation described here, two domains will appear: Bank1 - Company1, and Bank1 - Company2.

Within each domain, questions and answers are organised by folders. A typical folder could for instance be called Importer Area, to address concerns specific to importers. One level deeper, the topics organise the information within one folder, and each of them contains a set of questions and answers.

section.para: It is up to the users at the bank to create and organise the folders and topics. Client users can browse or search through the existing folders and topics, and submit new questions which will immediately become visible to the users at the appropriate bank. As a bank user, your main task in this module is to browse through the database of existing questions and answers, and to answer the pending questions.

section.title: Using CRM
section.para: When you click Customer Relationship Management, you are presented with a list of domains available to your bank. Click the one for the company whose questions you want to see.

Alternatively you can click Search to search for questions containing a given text, or List Unanswered for a list of all questions that users at the selected company have submitted but that have not yet been answered. These two functions are available on every page in .

Having selected a domain, you then get a list of folders in that domain. This page also has an Add New Folder function. To create a folder, click this link, type a name for the folder, and click Save.
Each folder in the list has a Modify link beside it. Click this to get a page where you can delete or rename the folder.

Click a folder in the list to get a tree view showing the topics in that folder, and the questions within the topics. Each question is followed by a number showing how may answers the bank has posted for it. This page also has an Add New Topic function. To create a topic, click this link, type a name for the topic, and click Save.
Click a question in the tree view to see the full question and its answers.

Alternatively, click a topic in the tree view to get a tree view showing just that topic and the questions within it. From this single-topic view (and from no other) you get an additional function Add New Question. You can use this to add questions other than those sent in by client users. To add a question, click this function, type your question, and click Save.

Your question is immediately added to the database and so is accessible to users both at your bank and at the company corresponding to the selected domain. It is also brought to the attention of users at your bank by appearing in the list of Trade Recent Requests on their home pages
Also at the bottom of this single-topic tree view is a Modify this Topic function. Click this to get a page where you can delete or rename the topic.

On the page that shows a question and its answers, click Add New Answer to add an answer. Alternatively, click Modify by the question or by an answer to get a page where you can edit or delete it. The page where you enter or edit an answer includes facilities enabling you to format what you type - you can specify font, font-size, and colour, insert links and images, and so on.
At the top of each page in your tree view is a toolbar (sometimes called a breadcrumb trail) showing where in the tree you currently are. You can move back up the tree by clicking in this toolbar.
